passage_text: History and Origin. Gina (occasional variants Geena, Gena, Jeana, Jeanna) is a feminine given name, in origin a hypocoristic form of names ending in-gina (by metanalysis of the latinate feminine suffix-ina), such as Luigina, Regina or Georgina, also of Virginia or Eugenia. It is more often used as a girl (female) name. People having the name Gina are in general originating from Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Dominican Republic, France, Italy, Netherlands, Romania, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom, United States of America.

Meaning of Gina. English name. In English, the name Gina means-A diminutive of Georgina, Virgina, Eugina, Regina, and other names ending in-gina. Often used as an independent name. Famous bearer: twentieth century Italian actress Gina Lollobrigida.. Other origins for the name Gina include-English, Italian, African-American.The name Gina is most often used as a girl name or female name. English Name Meaning-A diminutive of Georgina, Virgina, Eugina, Regina, and other names ending in-gina.

Usage: Gina, of African origin, is a very popular first name. It is more often used as a girl (female) name. People having the name Gina are in general originating from Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Dominican Republic, France, Italy, Netherlands, Romania, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom, United States of America.

Origin of the name Gina: Originally a short form of Georgine (earthworker), Gina is also used as an independent given name. From A World of Baby Names by Teresa Norman. Comments and insights on the name Gina: | Edit. Gina can be short for Virginia, Regina, or Genevieve. It is also the Italian version of Jean.. Gina and Inga are anagrams of each other; they contain the same letters.

Gina is also an English, German, and Italian shortening of the name Regina (English, German, and Polish). Gina is also a Spanish diminutive of Virginia. See also the related form, the English Lagina. Gina is uncommon as a baby name for girls. At the height of its usage in 1967, 0.371% of baby girls were named Gina. Gina is also a Russian and Spanish shortening of the name Georgina (English, German, Russian, and Spanish) as well as a Russian and Spanish variant transcription of the name Georgia (English). Gina is also a variant transcription of the name Jean (English and Scottish).

Originally a short form of Georgine (earthworker), Gina is also used as an independent given name. Comments and insights on the name Gina: | Edit. Gina can be short for Virginia, Regina, or Genevieve. It is also the Italian version of Jean.. Gina and Inga are anagrams of each other; they contain the same letters.

Gina /gi-na/ [2 sylls.] as a girls' name is pronounced GEE-nah. Short form of names ending in-gina, such as Georgina and Regina, or of Virginia. Also a feminine form of Gene, or a variant of Jean. Independent use dates from the 1920s. Actresses Gina Lollobrigida, Geena Davis, Gena Rowlands

The name Gina is a Greek baby name. In Greek the meaning of the name Gina is: Well born. American Meaning: The name Gina is an American baby name. In American the meaning of the name Gina is: Well born. English Meaning: The name Gina is an English baby name. In English the meaning of the name Gina is: A, Virgina, Eugina, Regina, and other names ending in-gina. Often used as an independent name. Famous bearer: twentieth century Italian actress Gina Lollobrigida.

Meaning & History. Short form of GEORGINA, REGINA, LUIGINA, and other names ending in gina. It can also be used as a diminutive of VIRGINIA or EUGENIA. It was popularized in the 1950s by Italian actress Gina Lollobrigida (1927-), whose birth name was Luigina. Expand Name Links
